Shop now 2025 Seedling Sale Vicki's Annual Seedling Sale coming May 17 & 18, 2025! 10-4 each day. Seasonal Veggies! Seasonal veggies available May-October specializing in heirloom tomatoes Tours of the garden available by appointment - contact Vicki by Phone/Text: 613-848-7791 Local bottled lemonade by Lemonade Dave available every day - www.lemonadedave.ca 2024 Vicki's Veggies Calendar The 2024 edition of Vicki's famous calendar is here! Includes all the key dates you need to remember plus some really awesome photos! Click here to buy now for just $25! Seed Saving 2024 Here are  some examples from this year! Vicki's Seed Saver How-To ROADSIDE STAND The Roadside Stand will open in May for the season! Drop by Vicki's roadside stand/store at 81 Morrison Point road to pick up seasonal vegetables, leafy greens, and all kinds of goodness fresh from the farm.  You can even pick up local bottled lemonade from Lemonade Dave. Make it part of your adventure as you tour around PEC! WHO IS VICKI? Vicki Emlaw is an eight generation family farmer from Milford, Ontario. She originally started Vicki's Veggie's back in 2001 and continues the family tradition to this day. Subscribe to our newsletter Promotions, new products and sales. Directly to your inbox. Sign up to our mailing list Subscribe CONTACT VICKI Get in touch with Vicki to learn more about the farm, order seedlings, or buy some veggies! Phone/Text: 613-848-7791 Email: vickiemlaw@gmail.com Location: 81 Morrison Point Rd., Black River, Ontario, K0K 2P0 Seedlings Calendar Roadside Stand Search Facebook Instagram Country/region Canada Miss Vicki's On the River Gift & Greeting Cards - Email, Text or Print - 1029 Baillies Bluff Rd, Holiday, FL Restaurants Travel Spa & Beauty Activities Shopping Universal Brands Top Cities Multi-Place Corporate Restaurants Travel Spa & Beauty Activities Shopping Universal Brands Top Cities Multi-Place Corporate Gifts Gift Cards Holiday Restaurants Miss Vicki's On the River Miss Vicki's On the River Gift Card Miss Vicki's On the River Giftly A beautiful gift card alternative for Miss Vicki's On the River Miss Vicki's On the River 100% satisfaction guarantee Gift Amount $25 $50 $75 $100 $250 $500 $1000 Other Gift Design Continue 100% satisfaction guarantee Enter an amount between $5 and $1,000 Confirm Amount Miss Vicki's On the River (253) (727) 940-7237 Categories Bars, American, Seafood Location 1029 Baillies Bluff Rd, Holiday, FL Gift Tips Try the crab cakes that are made fresh in-house; they are highly praised and considered fantastic by many guests. Order the blackened fish for a flavorful and well-seasoned dish that isn't charred, offering a nice crunch. Don't miss the shrimp platter—it's known for generous portions and great value. Enjoy the waterfront seating, especially under the trees for a lovely view of the sunset. For a relaxed atmosphere, visit while they have live music to enhance your dining experience. Click here to send a gift up to $1,000 with the suggestion to use it at Miss Vicki's On the River. Is this your business? Claim your business to update business information, customize this listing, and more! Learn more about Miss Vicki's On the River Price $$ Ambience Casual Miss Vicki's On the River is a delightful waterside restaurant located in Holiday, FL. Nestled near the Anclote River, the restaurant offers a serene atmosphere perfect for a casual dining experience. Ambiance : Casual vibe with outdoor seating along the water. Cuisine : Specializes in seafood, burgers, and sandwiches with a relaxed beach theme. Highlights : Beautiful sunset views, friendly service, and popular crab cakes. Guests appreciate the attentive service and the unique charm of this local gem. While the food is delicious, it's the beautiful views that really make dining at Miss Vicki's special. Whether arriving by car or boat, visitors are sure to enjoy a memorable meal in a relaxed setting. Great Alternatives Gift $100 for Angelos Pizza : Indulge in the mouthwatering flavors and authentic Italian taste of Angelos Pizza, your go-to destination for delicious pies in the charming town of Holiday. Buy a Gift & Greeting Card for La Fondita de Leo : La Fondita de Leo in Holiday serves up mouthwatering Mexican cuisine with a delightful twist, making it a go-to destination for flavorful dishes and a vibrant dining experience. Updated: September 03, 2025 The Giftly Advantage With Giftly you strike a perfect balance, the thoughtfulness of a Miss Vicki's On the River gift card with the flexibility of money. The real Miss Vickie, of potato chip fame, makes her TikTok debut Search query Search the web Skip to main News Finance More -1 Manage your account Help Add or switch accounts Sign out Search the web Advertisement Advertisement Return to Homepage The real Miss Vickie, of potato chip fame, makes her TikTok debut A Canadian snack icon, Miss Vickie, is making her debut on TikTok — much to her fans' delight. Elianna Lev Tue, October 17, 2023 at 4:27 p.m. UTC 2 min read The real Miss Vickie, of potato chip fame, makes her TikTok debut A Canadian snack icon, Miss Vickie, is making her debut on TikTok — much to her fans' delight. Vickie Kerr, the founder of Miss Vickie’s potato chips, has started an account with the intention of connecting directly with people who love her famed snacks. While Miss Vickie's chips can be found across North America and Europe, sold everywhere from Costco to Subway franchises, not much is made of its Canadian roots. Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Kerr initially created the product in 1987 from her farm in New Lowell, Ontario. Frustrated with the trans fats and preservatives that were found in potato chips at the time, she was compelled to create a better product for her family, using peanut oil instead. ( The products now use canola or sunflower oil.) After testing out her homemade chips at markets and food festivals, Kerr was garnered a loyal following. The family eventually sold their company to Frito-Lay in 1993, but still maintained relationships with their customers. That’s evident on Kerr’s TikTok, where she has quickly racked up over 35,000 followers and posts videos replying to fan comments. In a video posted Oct. 15, she says comments reminded her of when she first started her business and would ask her customers to tell her how they liked her product. After working at the plant, she’d go home to put her kids to bed, and then respond to some of the thousands of letters she’d receive from fans. “It was such a joy to be able to do that,” she says. “It made me have a connection with my customers, and I loved it.” Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Many are taking to the comment section of her two posts so far to share their enthusiasm for the products she helped create, and their special connection with the chips. “My husband hid my engagement ring in a bag of Miss Vickie’s! My fave,” one commenter wrote, to which Kerr replied, “Oh goodness how romantic!!” “When I was pregnant on my first I cried in a convenient store because they were out of Miss Vickie’s Salt and Vinegar. Sobbed,” another wrote. Another commenter wrote about how her family — “the Allan girls” — used to work for the company when it first started. “We loved having local women! I started a 4 day work week so we had 3 days to care for our families,” Kerr replied. Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Kerr clarifies that her account is a personal one, intended to recount stories of the history of the brand but that she no longer owns the company. Kerr isn’t the only member of her family to share the company’s history online. Her daughter, who goes by handle @littlemissCHIP-per, posts stories and memories from the company’s legacy. TikTok is a popular place for Miss Vickie’s lovers to share their enthusiasm for the snack, where they test out new flavours and try to replicate versions of their own.
